DOC.brief_summary: The study evaluate impact family-based intervention well-being Burmese migrant displace child family live Tak province , Thailand . The methodology use impact evaluation study randomize waitlist control trial . The study hypothesize participation family-based intervention lead improve parenting practice child family outcome , follow . Primary hypothesis : 1 . Parents/caregivers participate family-based intervention report increase knowledge use positive parenting skill compare control ; 2 . Parents/caregivers participate family-based intervention report less use physical punishment harsh form discipline compare control ; 3 . Parents/caregivers child participate family-based intervention report high level family function cohesion compare control . Secondary hypothesis : 1 . Parents/caregivers child participate family-based intervention report low level externalize internalize child behavior compare control ; 2 . Parents/caregivers child participate family-based intervention report high level child resilience psychosocial well-being compare control ; 3 . Parents/caregivers participate family-based intervention report low level alcohol use compare control .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Evaluation Family-based Intervention With Burmese Migrant Displaced Children Families Tak Province , Thailand
DOC.criteria: Of Burmese origin Currently live one 20 target community Tak province , Thailand Primary caregiver least one child age 8 12 year Child age 8 12 year Participating family intervention Children living orphanage , board house , factory institution Persons severe cognitive physical disability impair unable understand give inform consent
